title: Ropes & Gray Group Hires Former DOJ Compliance Expert; Hui Chen, who advised criminal prosecutors as the first in-house compliance counsel expert at the Justice Department, will serve as a senior adviser in the law firm's R&G Insights Lab
text:
The group brings together a multidisciplinary team including lawyers, a behavioral scientist and others to advise clients on compliance, risk and other challenges.

Ms. Chen was in 2015 a high-profile hire for the Justice Department—one that department leadership frequently touted—and was brought on board to provide guidance to prosecutors evaluating the effectiveness of compliance programs and remedial measures.

While at the Justice Department, she helped craft guidance on how corporate-compliance programs would be evaluated, a document that has become an important guide for compliance practitioners.

She left the Justice Department in 2017, and since then the department has moved to using several attorneys to advise on compliance considerations.

Ms. Chen, who is trained as a lawyer, also worked as the first foreign expert consultant to the Brazilian comptroller general of the union and as an adviser to the attorney general of Hawaii.

She also previously held in-house compliance roles at Microsoft Corp., Pfizer Inc. and Standard Chartered Bank.

Ropes & Gray is among a number of law firms that recently have made efforts to build multidisciplinary teams to try to help clients solve thorny risk and compliance issues.
